text_info.text: What are the steps of self-reflection listed in the PDF for assessing the project?
The steps of self-reflection listed are: Purpose, Winning, Mastery, Constraint, Date, The Work, Reflection, and Generous Contribution.
What question should the author ask themselves to gauge their understanding of the project's goal?
The author should ask themselves, "Do I know who does this project activates a relationship with?"
How can the author determine if they know what a successful project outcome looks like?
The author can determine this by asking themselves, "Do I know what it looks like when it's working?"
What aspect of the project should the author be aware of to achieve mastery?
The author should know what the unknown is in the project.
What should the author identify as a potential limiting factor in the project?
The author should identify what their next constraint is, which could be time, money, knowledge, direction, or approval.
How should the author plan for the project's future progress?
The author should ask themselves, "Have I set my next delivery point?"
What question can help the author clarify the main focus of the project?
The author can ask themselves, "Do I know what the real work to be done here is?"
How can the author evaluate the quality of their work?
The author can evaluate the quality of their work by asking themselves, "Is this my best work?"
What approach should the author take to benefit from their team's perspectives?
The author should ask their team, "What will I ask my team? What might they see here that I don’t?"

What is the purpose of the STEM Materials Center Advisory Committee meeting on September 25, 2019?

The purpose of the meeting was to discuss and approve the agenda items, including the approval of May 5th, 2019 meeting minutes, budget forecast and previous year actuals, elementary program updates, middle school updates, family STEM night kits, and present the revised operating practices document for feedback.
Who was unable to attend the meeting and which regions do they represent?
Doug Hood from Region 1 and Chris Griffith from Region 4 were unable to attend the meeting.
How much was the total expenditure for the 2018-19 budget and what is the estimated carryover for the 2019-20 budget?
The total expenditure for the 2018-19 budget was $460,663, and there was an estimated carryover of $5,285 for the 2019-20 budget.
What is the proposed deficit for the 2019-20 budget, and how does the committee plan to address it?

The proposed deficit for the 2019-20 budget is $14,882. The committee plans to address it by increasing member contributions, reducing staffing/temp costs and critter expenditures, and supplementing any remaining deficit through grants throughout the year.
What are some of the resources provided by the OpenSciED program for middle school teachers?
The OpenSciED program provides resources such as teacher guides, student work samples, video clips, PowerPoint presentations, and prepared handouts for middle school teachers.
What is the purpose of the family STEM night kits, and how will they be made available?

The purpose of the family STEM night kits is to provide hands-on science, math, and engineering activities for students and families to complete together. The kits will be developed using recycled materials from the SMC and will be available for Cooperative districts to check out for hosting their own family STEM night events.
When and where is Vickei planning to present the Revised Operating Practices Document?
Vickei plans to present the Revised Operating Practices Document at the Regional Superintendents meeting on January 15th.

<section_header_level_1><loc_268><loc_25><loc_449><loc_41>Teaching & Learning Division STEM Materials Center Advisory Committee</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_365><loc_44><loc_449><loc_68>September 25, 2019 Cowlitz Room 9:30 am - 11:00 am</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_207><loc_78><loc_295><loc_84>AGENDA & MINUTES</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_94><loc_97><loc_100>Attendees</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_82><loc_103><loc_136><loc_110>Participants:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_82><loc_112><loc_227><loc_117>Region 2: Lacey DeWeert - Kelso, Longview</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_120><loc_322><loc_125>Region 3: Eric Nerison - Kalama, Castle Rock, Toutle Lake and Woodland</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_128><loc_431><loc_133>Region 5: Jerry Lewis (Chair) - White Salmon, Centerville, Glenwood, Klickitat, Lyle, Trout Lake, Roosevelt</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_135><loc_393><loc_141>Region 6: Ralph Pruitt - Ocean Beach, Naselle, Wahkiakum, Mill A, Mount Pleasant, Skamania</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_143><loc_267><loc_148>Region 7: Rhonda Rogers - Private and at-large districts</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_158><loc_328><loc_164>ESD 112: Mike Nerland, Associate Superintendent of Teaching & Learning</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_166><loc_211><loc_171>ESD 112: Vickei Hrdina, STEM Director</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_174><loc_230><loc_179>ESD 112: Angel Almendarez, Budget Analyst</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_189><loc_130><loc_196>Unable to attend:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_82><loc_199><loc_223><loc_204>Region 1: Doug Hood - Camas, Washougal</text>
<text><loc_82><loc_206><loc_344><loc_211>Region 4: Chris Griffith - Ridgefield, Green Mountain, Hockinson and La Center</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_222><loc_121><loc_230>Agenda Items</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_242><loc_184><loc_249>Approval of May 5 th , 2019 Minutes</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_251><loc_416><loc_266>Ralph Pruitt motioned to approve the minutes from the May 5 th , 2019 meeting and Lacey DeWeert seconded the motion. Motion passed unanimously.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_277><loc_214><loc_283>Budget Forecast and Previous Year Actuals</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_286><loc_444><loc_300>The 2018-19 budget expenditures came to a total of $460,663, with member contributions being $465,947 that leave an estimated $5,285 carryover for 2019-20.</text>
<text><loc_53><loc_311><loc_438><loc_368>The proposed 2019-20 budget comes to a total of $451,697 with a total of $431,530 in member contributions. With the $5,285 carryover from 2019-20 that leaves an estimated deficit of $14,882. The amendments to the contracts have not been done for added teacher counts and extra material orders so the member contributions will increase. There will also be some reduction in staffing/temp costs and in critter expenditures this year. Vickei Hrdina expects any remaining deficit will be supplemented through grants throughout the year. You can view the breakdown the 2019-20 budget forecast here.  Vickei will Provide the final budget for approval at the next meeting.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_387><loc_168><loc_393>Elementary Program Updates:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_396><loc_448><loc_453>Four new storylines have been published since the last advisory meeting in May, two for first grade and two for second grade. There are currently eight available storylines that help teachers transition between activities and build connections and coherence through the investigations. Pranjali Upadhyay and her team will be focusing on developing four additional storylines during the 2019-10 school year, Animals 2x2 in kindergarten, Mixtures and Solutions in 5 th grade, Beyond Weather and Climate in 3rd grade, and Living Systems in 5 th grade.  You can view all available storylines here, they are also be available on the ESD website so teachers may access them anytime.</text>
<page_break>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_25><loc_144><loc_31>Middle School Updates:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_33><loc_445><loc_81>The ESD has been participating in a 3-year OpenSciED nationwide pilot for some new openly licensed materials being developed through the University of Texas, Dana Center and Northwestern University. Ridgefield and Kalama are continuing to participate in this pilot. OpenSciED provides teachers with support in the form of teacher guides, student work samples, video clips PowerPoint presentations and prepared handouts. Stacy Meyer will host an OpenSciED info session this fall/winter and Vickei will gather interest to build a model budget.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_93><loc_141><loc_99>Family STEM Night kits:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_101><loc_444><loc_158>Vickei has been communicating with retired science teacher from Washougal, Marlin Martin, about developing some family STEM night kits.  A STEM Family Nights include hands-on science, math, and engineering activities for students and families to complete together. These events include a range of activities covering different STEM topics and connections to exciting STEM careers. Vickei will work with Marlin to recycle unused materials from the SMC to put together kits that will be available for Cooperative districts to check out so they can host their own family STEM night. By recycling unused materials from the SMC there will be no additional cost to the SMC budget.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_169><loc_202><loc_175>Revised Operating Practices Document:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_177><loc_425><loc_192>Vickei will be presenting the Revised Operating Practices at the Regional Superintendents meeting on January 15 th to gain feedback from additional districts representatives.</text>

What is the primary purpose of the book Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions?
The primary purpose of the book Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions is to teach undergraduate students the fundamentals of fluid mechanics, hydraulic science, and hydraulics engineering.
What format are the free ebooks from Amazon available in?
The free ebooks from Amazon are only available in Kindle format.
What additional resource is available for Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions?
An additional resource available for Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions is an interactive solutions viewer that allows users to check their reasoning and step-by-step problem-solving.
How does Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions blend different subjects?
Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions blends fluid mechanics, hydraulic science, and hydraulics engineering, making it suitable for a diversified class of students.
Can you explain the "Any Reason" guarantee mentioned in the text?

The "Any Reason" guarantee mentioned in the text refers to the fact that if you rent the textbook Elementary Hydraulics 1st edition, you can return it at any time during the 21-day rental period for any reason.
What are some of the key concepts covered in the first part of Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions?
The first part of Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions covers fluid mechanics concepts deemed essential to the teaching of hydraulics, including a summary of relevant material.
Who are the authors of Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions?
The authors of Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions are James F. Cruise, Mohsen M. Sherif, and Vijay P. Singh.
Besides Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions, what is another subject covered by the authors in their published works?

Besides Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions, the authors have also published works related to various other subjects, such as ocean turtle rescue programs, technical solutions for cruise vacations, and mathematical investigations in fluid dynamics.
How do the details in the text help potential readers make an informed decision about obtaining "Elementary Hydraulics Cruise Solutions" online?

The text provides details about the various editions and formats of the book available on Amazon, including information on the publishers (CENGAGE Learning, MIT Press, etc.) and formats (MOBI, Kindle, PDF, etc.). This information helps potential readers compare the different options and choose the one that best meets their needs. Additionally, the text mentions the availability of a free sample and solution manual, which can give readers a taste of the content and help them decide whether to purchase the book.
What is the purpose of mentioning the authors and their affiliations in the text?

The purpose of mentioning the authors and their affiliations is to establish their credibility and expertise in the field of hydraulics engineering. This information can help readers evaluate the quality and reliability of the content in the book.
How does the text address the needs of a diversified class of students?

The text states that the book is written for the undergraduate level and contains material to appeal to a diversified class of students. It mentions that the book blends fluid mechanics, hydraulic science, and hydraulics engineering, and is divided into three parts. This information suggests that the book covers a range of topics and approaches, and is designed to be accessible to students with different backgrounds and interests.

What is the title of the first volume of John Richardson's biography of Picasso?
The title of the first volume is "A Life of Picasso: The Prodigy, 1881-1906."
Which award did the first volume of the biography win?
The first volume won the Whitbread Award for book of the year.
What time period does the first volume of the biography cover?
The first volume covers the time period from 1881 to 1906.
Which three European cities are mentioned as places where Picasso spent his early years?
The three European cities mentioned are Malaga, Barcelona, and Paris.
What is the subject matter of Picasso's work as described by John Richardson?
According to John Richardson, Picasso's work is like a diary, and to understand it, one must see how it mirrors his life.
What artistic movements are mentioned in relation to Picasso's early work?
The Blue Period and Rose Period are mentioned in relation to Picasso's early work.
What year did Picasso produce the sets and costumes with Cocteau for Diaghilev’s Ballets Russes?
The document does not specify the year Picasso produced the sets and costumes.
What is the title of the second volume of John Richardson's biography of Picasso?
The title of the second volume is "A Life of Picasso: The Cubist Rebel, 1907-1916."
What significant event during WWI is mentioned in the biography?
The death of Guillaume Apollinaire is mentioned as a significant event during WWI.
What is the name of the artist who became a trusted friend of Picasso?
John Richardson became a trusted friend of Picasso.

Here is Picasso at the height of his powers in Rome and Naples, producing the sets and costumes with Cocteau for Diaghilev's Ballets Russes, and visiting Pompei where the antique statuary fuel his obsession with classicism; in Paris, creating some of his most important sculpture and painting as part of a ...</text>

<text><loc_10><loc_95><loc_481><loc_102>This volume is one of three which describe in great detail the life of one of the greatest artists of all time. The author weaves together a fascinating life with Picasso's varied artistic works and the events and people of his time. If you enjoy volume !, you should also read the subsequent 2 volumes. The only downside is the large amount of detail.</text>

<text><loc_10><loc_112><loc_408><loc_115>The first volume of his Life of Picasso was published to wide acclaim in 1991 and won England's prestigious Whitbread Prize. In 1993 he was made a Corresponding Fellow of the British Academy. In 1994-95 he served as the Slade Professor of Art at Oxford University.</text>

<text><loc_10><loc_126><loc_434><loc_128>Of the three volumes of A Life of Picasso that have been completed, I liked The Cubist Rebel, 1907-1916 best. What is the purpose of a wiring diagram?

A wiring diagram serves as a streamlined standard pictorial representation of an electric circuit, revealing the components and the power and signal links between them. It is typically used to troubleshoot problems, ensure proper connections, and for building or manufacturing the circuit or electronic device.
Where can the SnowDogg MD75 plow owner find the colors of the wires for the upgraded plow lights?
The colors of the wires for the upgraded plow lights can be found by consulting members of the forum who have experience with the MD75 SnowDogg plow and have completed similar upgrades.
How does the SnowDogg relay isolation module work regarding the plow lights?

The SnowDogg relay isolation module diverts switched power or ground for the plow high and low beams from the truck harness to the snowplow lights when the plow is connected. This ensures that there is no additional draw from the plow lights.
What should be done if the status light on the SnowDogg MD75 plow is blinking?
If the status light on the SnowDogg MD75 plow is blinking, the owner should refer to troubleshooting guidelines, which can be found in the manual.
What is the warranty policy for defective SnowDogg plows?

The SnowDogg plow comes with a 10-day warranty policy for defects, provided that the owner discovers the defect within 10 days of purchase and returns the defective snowplow to an authorized SnowDogg Dealer along with proof of purchase and applicable maintenance records. The customer is responsible for all transportation costs to and from the dealer.

What is the purpose of the resolution discussed in the text?

The purpose of the resolution is to approve the redevelopment contract of the Philadelphia Redevelopment Authority for the redevelopment and urban renewal of a portion of the Haddington Urban Renewal Area, Unit Nos. 2 and 3, and to authorize the Redevelopment Authority to execute the redevelopment contract with Danielle M. Carson-Varns.
Who introduced Resolution No. 160204 to the City Council?
Councilmember Blackwell introduced Resolution No. 160204 to the City Council.
What are the boundaries of the property being redeveloped, according to the resolution?

The boundaries of the property being redeveloped are as follows: on the south side of Wyalusing Avenue, commencing at the distance of one hundred four feet two inches eastward from the east side of Fifty-second street in the Forty-fourth Ward of the City of Philadelphia, containing in front fifteen feet eight inches in breadth on the said Wyalusing Avenue, and extending southward between parallel lines with the said Fifty-second street, seventy-four feet to a certain three feet wide alley extending eastward into Creighton street.
When was the urban renewal plan and redevelopment proposal for the Haddington Urban Renewal Area approved by the Council?
The urban renewal plan and redevelopment proposal for the Haddington Urban Renewal Area were approved by Ordinance of the Council on September 29, 1969, as amended.
Which departments, boards, and agencies does the resolution request to cooperate in carrying out the redevelopment contract?
The resolution requests various officials, departments, boards, and agencies of the City having administrative responsibilities to cooperate in carrying out the redevelopment contract.
What kind of changes does the resolution authorize the Redevelopment Authority and the Redeveloper to make as part of the redevelopment?

The resolution authorizes the Redevelopment Authority and the Redeveloper to make minor changes in substantial conformity with the approved redevelopment contract, including changes in zoning, streets, alleys, public ways, street patterns, location and relocation of public utilities, and related items required to facilitate and effectuate the redevelopment contract.

What are the top 10 safety tips provided by the Federation of Ontario Cottagers' Associations for opening a cottage?

The top 10 safety tips for opening a cottage include checking the car's lights, signals, tire pressure, and fluids; assembling a first-aid kit for the cottage and car; reviewing the condition of boats and safety equipment; checking the electricity meter and interior wiring; installing and maintaining smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors; removing dry leaves and debris from the roof and/or eavestroughs; preparing for extreme weather events by creating an emergency plan; discussing insurance coverage for cottage, car, and boat; talking to neighbors and planning for emergencies by identifying vulnerable people; and sharing this information with other waterfront property owners.
What precautions should be taken when securing a cottage during the closing period?

Precautions to secure a cottage during the closing period include leaving no valuables at the cottage, securing and hiding or locking vehicles and their equipment, removing snow machines' tracks and hiding keys, covering and locking boats, disabling ATVs, locking and disassembling outboard motors slightly, securing cottage windows and doors, packing up and taking home all alcohol, not leaving firearms or weapons at the cottage, marking personal items, making lists of property left at and returning to the cottage, identifying a keyholder for property-related issues, and knowing the local OPP Detachment that patrols the cottage community.
What steps should be taken to prepare for extreme weather events when opening a cottage?

Steps to prepare for extreme weather events when opening a cottage include creating a family emergency preparedness plan for the cottage, considering what the family would need to survive there for 72 hours in a time of emergency, and sharing this information with other waterfront property owners.
Why is it important to talk to insurance representatives when opening or closing a cottage, and what are some considerations to keep in mind?

It is important to talk to insurance representatives when opening or closing a cottage to review coverage for cottage, car, and boat. Some considerations to keep in mind include understanding that many property insurance policies carry exclusions related to water damage and to ensure that one understands what they are covered for.
Why is it recommended to identify local OPP Detachment that patrols the cottage community?

It is recommended to identify the local OPP Detachment that patrols the cottage community to have contact information for reporting alarms, thefts, weather-related damage, animal problems, and other concerns that may arise while the cottage is unoccupied.

<doctag><section_header_level_1><loc_92><loc_38><loc_412><loc_48>Cottage Opening - Top 10 Safety Tips from FOCA</section_header_level_1>
<picture><loc_72><loc_53><loc_424><loc_132></picture>
<section_header_level_1><loc_81><loc_136><loc_419><loc_145>Start the cottage season right, by following these tips:</section_header_level_1>
<unordered_list><list_item><loc_60><loc_156><loc_445><loc_163>1. Check your car's lights, signals, tire pressure and fluids before the trip to the cottage.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_172><loc_443><loc_188>2. Assemble a first-aid kit for your cottage and your car. Already got these? Review the contents of the kits, and replace any missing or expired supplies.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_197><loc_411><loc_213>3. Review the condition of boat(s), including fuel lines and tanks. Ensure that all required safety equipment is on board and in good repair.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_222><loc_423><loc_238>4. Check your electricity meter and interior wiring, cords and plugs for any signs of gnawing or other damage before turning on your power for the season!</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_247><loc_415><loc_254>5. Install and maintain cottage smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_263><loc_439><loc_279>6. Remove dry leaves and debris from the cottage roof and/or eavestroughs to reduce fire risk. (Remember: use ladders with caution!)</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_288><loc_430><loc_304>7. Boating in spring weather? Beware of the dangers of cold water immersion. Get more tips for boating and cold water safety, here: https://foca.on.ca/safe-boating/</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_313><loc_443><loc_338>8. Talk to your insurance representative to review your cottage, car and boat coverage. Bear in mind that many property insurance policies carry exclusions related to water damage - check yours and be sure you understand what you are covered for.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_347><loc_435><loc_371>9. Prepare for extreme weather events by creating a family emergency preparedness plan for the cottage. Just like at home, consider what your family would need to survive at the cottage for 72 hours in a time of emergency.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_381><loc_434><loc_396>10.  Talk to your neighbours, and plan ahead for emergencies by identifying vulnerable people as well as potential community volunteers.</list_item>
</unordered_list>
<picture><loc_60><loc_424><loc_194><loc_456></picture>
<text><loc_225><loc_423><loc_414><loc_441>Please share this information with other waterfront property owners!</text>
<page_footer><loc_218><loc_451><loc_429><loc_456>Federation of Ontario Cottagers' Associations: https://foca.on.ca</page_footer>
<page_break>
<section_header_level_1><loc_95><loc_42><loc_409><loc_52>Cottage Closing - Top 10 Safety Tips from FOCA</section_header_level_1>
<picture><loc_62><loc_53><loc_442><loc_141></picture>
<unordered_list><list_item><loc_60><loc_151><loc_414><loc_166>1. Leave no valuables at the cottage - electronics, personal items, tools etc. unless you're prepared to lose them!</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_176><loc_442><loc_191>2. Sporting goods - fishing rods & equipment, water skis, toys etc. - don't expect them to be there next spring, if they're not secured (locked up, hidden or both).</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_201><loc_440><loc_234>3. If you are leaving vehicles, make sure they're winterized, secure and disabled - for snow machines, remove track and hide keys, ensure boats are covered and locked, outboard motors locked and slightly disassembled. ATVs disabled - leave nothing on trailers unless it is locked or disabled. Remember - ' Lock it or Lose it! '</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_243><loc_434><loc_259>4. Secure your cottage windows and doors - close window curtains or blinds and put up shutters to protect interior from marauders (animals and human).</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_268><loc_230><loc_275>5. Pack up and take home all alcohol.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_284><loc_289><loc_291>6. Do not leave firearms or weapons at the cottage.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_301><loc_433><loc_325>7. Marking your personal items can make it difficult for thieves to resell stolen goods, and will make it easier for your items to be identified and returned if found. Record the serial numbers of anything of value left behind.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_334><loc_414><loc_350>8. Make a list of the property you are leaving at the cottage, and also a list of the property that will return to your cottage on your first or next trip there.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_359><loc_410><loc_375>9. Identify who is your cottage property key holder for alarms, thefts, weather damage or animal problems.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_60><loc_384><loc_425><loc_400>10.  Know your local OPP Detachment that patrols your cottage community. (search: www.opp.ca › OPP Home › Contact Us or call 1-888-310-1122)</list_item>
</unordered_list>
<picture><loc_64><loc_424><loc_197><loc_457></picture>
<text><loc_227><loc_424><loc_416><loc_442>Please share this information with other waterfront property owners!</text>
<page_footer><loc_219><loc_452><loc_429><loc_457>Federation of Ontario Cottagers' Associations: https://foca.on.ca</page_footer>

The text describes the EMAS pump, a small diameter piston pump used for lifting water. It is typically made with a PVC pipe for the pump rod and operates with an up and down movement.

The EMAS pump has several advantages over rope pumps, including being 10-30% cheaper, simpler in construction, capable of lifting water up to 20 meters high, fitting in small tube wells, and being producible using local materials.

The disadvantages of the EMAS pump compared to rope pumps include an up and down movement, 20-30% lower pump capacity, plastic parts becoming brittle in sunlight, requiring regular replacement, and it not being widely known in Malawi, necessitating training and a critical mass for scaling up.

The pump capacity of EMAS pumps ranges from 25 liters per minute for wells 0 to 10 meters deep, to 5 liters per minute for wells 10 to 35 meters deep. The cost of EMAS pumps ranges from USD 50 to 70 (off workshop).
The EMAS pumps are produced by the Info SMART Centre Tanzania. They have been successfully installed at a family farm in Nicaragua.
The EMAS pump can pump water to tanks up to 20 meters high, as demonstrated in the bottom photograph.

What is the issue with the piston type metering devices in Multi-Family Horizontal (Pancake) Ceiling Hung Fan Coils?

The issue is that the pistons are not seating properly due to excessive debris in the piston body, causing low head pressure, high suction pressure, little to no superheat, and excessive condensation.
What part number is specified for the Neoprene Rubber O-rings that will help the piston stay in the fully seated position?
The part number for the Neoprene Rubber O-rings is C70104.
What precaution should be taken when cleaning the piston and body of the fan coil units?
Only trained and qualified personnel should clean the piston and body of the fan coil units.
Why should the compressor not be operated into a vacuum when cleaning the piston and body of the fan coil units?
The compressor should not be operated into a vacuum because it can cause damage and unusual/excessive sounds. Additionally, it may lead to refrigerant recovery issues.
What tools are required to remove the nut from the piston body of the fan coil units?
Two 8" adjustable wrenches are required, with one acting as a backup wrench.
How should the piston be seated back into the piston body after cleaning?

Place the piston back into the piston body, add the specified O-ring behind the piston, and put the nut back on finger tight. Turn the nut 1/4 turn with the backup wrench, being careful not to over-tighten.
What should be done to check for leaks after seating the piston back into the piston body and adding the O-ring?
Leak check the piston body with nitrogen, evacuate the refrigerant line set, and then open the liquid and suction service valves to release the stored refrigerant.
What method should be used to check the refrigerant charge after installing the Neoprene Rubber O-rings in the fan coil units?
Use the superheat method found in the outdoor units installation instructions to check the refrigerant charge.

<text><loc_29><loc_107><loc_61><loc_114>Title:</text>
<text><loc_68><loc_107><loc_274><loc_114>Piston Metering Device Not Seating</text>
<text><loc_29><loc_123><loc_143><loc_129>Product Category:</text>
<text><loc_158><loc_123><loc_213><loc_129>Fan Coils</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_147><loc_114><loc_152>Products Affected</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_165><loc_318><loc_169>Multi-Family Horizontal (Pancake) Ceiling Hung Fan Coil Units</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_182><loc_71><loc_187>Situation</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_29><loc_200><loc_464><loc_230>The factory has received field reports of fan coils with the piston type metering devices not seating properly due to excessive debris in the piston body. This will cause low head pressure with high suction pressure and little to no superheat. Often excessive condensation is observed flowing off the compressor and out from under the unit on to the condenser pad.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_243><loc_131><loc_248>Technical Information</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_260><loc_249><loc_265>The following information applies to A/C units only:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_29><loc_278><loc_457><loc_283>The factory qualified a Neoprene O-ring that will force the piston to stay in the fully seated position.</text>
<text><loc_29><loc_295><loc_441><loc_309>The O-Rings can be purchased at: The O-ring Store 7am-3pm Pacific Mon-Fri | 208-413-6377 Part number: C70104 Neoprene Rubber O-rings</text>
<text><loc_29><loc_313><loc_405><loc_317>http://www.theoringstore.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&products_id=16429</text>
<text><loc_29><loc_330><loc_358><loc_335>WARNING: DO NOT substitute this part specification for any other material!</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_29><loc_348><loc_265><loc_352>Cleaning the piston and body and installing the O-ring:</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_29><loc_365><loc_230><loc_370>Start by pumping the refrigerant system down.</text>
<unordered_list><list_item><loc_44><loc_374><loc_396><loc_378>1.) Attach a standard refrigerant gage set to the liquid and suction service valves.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_44><loc_383><loc_429><loc_388>2.) Close the liquid service valve and pump down the system using standard procedures.</list_item>
<list_item><loc_74><loc_392><loc_438><loc_396>a. Prepare the suction service valve for closing quickly with a service valve wrench.</list_item>
</unordered_list>
<text><loc_29><loc_400><loc_463><loc_423>Helpful Tips : When pressures between liquid and suction lines are close to being equalized the compressor will make unusual / excessive sounds as the scroll plates separate. This is normal. The suction gage will measure approximately 20 PSIG.</text>
<text><loc_29><loc_427><loc_319><loc_431>WARNING : DO NOT operate the scroll compressor into a vacuum!</text>
<unordered_list><list_item><loc_44><loc_435><loc_462><loc_449>3.) Stop the compressor when you hear rattling by disconnecting power quickly close the suction service valve. Recover the refrigerant that remains in the line set down to 5 PSIG.</list_item>
</unordered_list>
<text><loc_29><loc_454><loc_464><loc_468>Only trained and qualified personnel should design, install, repair and service HVAC systems and equipment. All national standards and safety codes must be followed when designing, installing, repairing and servicing HVAC systems and equipment. It is the responsibility of the Dealer to ensure local codes, standards, and ordinances are met.</text>

What is the legal age to consent to medical treatment without a parent or legal guardian present?
Any child under the age of 18 years old cannot be seen by a doctor without consent from a parent or legal guardian.
Under what circumstances can a minor be seen by a doctor without a parent or legal guardian present?
If the minor arrives with someone other than a parent or legal guardian who has written permission to act on behalf of the parent or legal guardian, or if the minor can act on their own behalf.
What information is required to be filled out for a minor's name and date of birth?
The minor's name and date of birth are required to be filled out.
What details must be provided when listing individuals who can give consent for the minor to receive medical treatment?
For each individual, their name, phone number, and relation to the patient must be provided.
What can be inferred about the responsibility for payment of medical services for the minor?
The adult presenting the minor, or the minor themselves, are responsible for payment of the patient portion at the time of service.
What types of medical services are authorized for the minor with the signature of a parent or legal guardian?
Routine medical care and interventions may include medical evaluation, physical exam, immunizations, injections, x-rays, lab work, minor burns, and minor suturing of lacerations.
What is the effect of signing this consent form?
Signing this consent form authorizes Family Health Services of Darke County, Inc. and its personnel to deliver routine medical treatment and services to the minor.
How long will this consent be in effect?
This consent shall be in effect for a specified date or indefinitely, until revoked by written notice.
How can a parent or legal guardian revoke the consent?
A parent or legal guardian can revoke the consent by sending a written notice to Family Health Services of Darke County, Inc. (in-person, fax, or email).

What is the main purpose of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central software?

Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is a comprehensive business management solution designed for small to medium-sized businesses. It integrates sales, marketing, service, operations, and commerce to provide a 360-degree view of the organization for better results.
What has been removed as the maximum user session timeout in Dynamics 365, Business Edition?
The maximum user session timeout of 24 hours has been removed in Dynamics 365, Business Edition.
How can customers connect their financials, sales, service, and operations in Dynamics 365 Business Central?
Customers can connect their financials, sales, service, and operations in Dynamics 365 Business Central through Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) program partners only.
Until when are Dynamics 365 Business Edition customers eligible to receive discounted transition pricing for the new Business Central offers?
Dynamics 365 Business Edition customers are eligible to receive discounted transition pricing for the new Business Central offers until June 30, 2020.
What additional components may be purchased separately for Dynamics 365 Business Edition?
Additional capacity for Dynamics 365 Business Edition may be purchased separately.
What is the minimum number of qualifying Dynamics 365 app users required for Dynamics 365, Business Edition?
A minimum of 10 users is required for Dynamics 365, Business Edition.
What does Dynamics 365, Business Edition archives indicate regarding insights for the end users and developers?

Dynamics 365, Business Edition archives indicate that the implementation covers the latest features of Dynamics Business Central and NAV from the end users' and developers' perspectives and provides insight into different tools available for implementation.
What are some of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications that can work seamlessly together?
Some of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications that can work seamlessly together include sales, marketing, service, operations, and commerce.

Which three major export markets showed encouraging growth in Malaysia's wood-based exports?
The three major export markets that showed encouraging growth were Europe, America, and Oceania.
Which continent was the biggest market for Malaysia's wood-based exports in Q1 2021?
The American continent was the biggest market for Malaysia's wood-based exports in Q1 2021.
What percentage of Malaysia's wood furniture exports to the American continent were purchased by the United States?
The United States purchased more than 60% of Malaysia's wood furniture exports to the American continent.
Which two markets experienced a decrease in Malaysia's wood-based exports in Q1 2021?
Both the African and Asian markets experienced a decrease in Malaysia's wood-based exports in Q1 2021.
What factors contributed to the positive growth of Malaysia's wood-based exports to the United States in Q1 2021?

The positive growth of Malaysia's wood-based exports to the United States in Q1 2021 was attributed to the US economic stimulus package, the US-China trade war, and increased demand for DIY products and wood furniture among those working from home.

<text><loc_34><loc_20><loc_153><loc_23>June 01, 2021 20:46 pm +08</text>
<picture><loc_102><loc_72><loc_399><loc_100></picture>
<picture><loc_62><loc_144><loc_435><loc_283></picture>
<picture><loc_407><loc_320><loc_426><loc_333></picture>
<text><loc_46><loc_350><loc_436><loc_396>KUALA LUMPUR (June 1): Total exports of the wood-based sector increased 9.9% year-on-year to RM6.04 billion in the rst quarter (Q1) of 2021, despite the the country facing the pandemic, said the Malaysian Timber Council (MTC).</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_408><loc_449><loc_430>Chief executive ocer Muhtar Suhaili said the three major export markets - Europe, America and Oceania - showed encouraging growth in exports.</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_442><loc_447><loc_464>Exports to Europe, the third largest market, showed a promising recovery with total exports rising by 9.9% to RM561.2 million.</text>
<picture><loc_46><loc_455><loc_399><loc_484></picture>
<page_footer><loc_22><loc_487><loc_287><loc_489>https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/malaysias-woodbased-exports-rise-rm604-bil-q1</page_footer>
<page_footer><loc_468><loc_487><loc_478><loc_489>2/8</page_footer>
<page_break>
<page_header><loc_22><loc_10><loc_48><loc_12>6/2/2021</page_header>
<page_header><loc_163><loc_10><loc_389><loc_12>Malaysia's wood-based exports rise to RM6.04 bil in Q1 | The Edge Markets</page_header>
<picture><loc_45><loc_17><loc_445><loc_205></picture>
<section_header_level_1><loc_46><loc_214><loc_333><loc_219>Electric vehicles - driving towards the future</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_46><loc_234><loc_436><loc_261>Modern problems require modern solutions. In a bid to curb environmental pollution, more countries are decreasing their dependency on fossilfuels, shifting to all-electric options in hopes of creating a cleaner and more environmentally sustainable world.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_271><loc_120><loc_275>READ MORE</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_46><loc_304><loc_449><loc_351>'This is due to the increase in demand for DIY (do it yourself) products and wood furniture among those working from home, as well as higherthan-usual purchases due to importers' concern over supply shortage and rising prices,' he said in a statement today.</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_363><loc_431><loc_397>The main products exported to the market were wood furniture worth RM242.9 million, joinery (RM96.5 million) and sawn timber (RM73.9 million).</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_409><loc_451><loc_431>Muhtar said exports to the American continent, the biggest market, surged 46.9% to RM2.44 billion in Q1 2021.</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_443><loc_430><loc_465>The United States was the main contributor in this market, purchasing more than 60% of the nation's wood furniture exports to the continent.</text>
<picture><loc_47><loc_458><loc_398><loc_483></picture>
<page_footer><loc_22><loc_487><loc_287><loc_489>https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/malaysias-woodbased-exports-rise-rm604-bil-q1</page_footer>
<page_footer><loc_468><loc_487><loc_478><loc_489>3/8</page_footer>
<page_break>
<page_header><loc_22><loc_10><loc_48><loc_12>6/2/2021</page_header>
<page_header><loc_163><loc_10><loc_389><loc_12>Malaysia's wood-based exports rise to RM6.04 bil in Q1 | The Edge Markets</page_header>
<text><loc_46><loc_24><loc_423><loc_83>'This positive growth is due to the US economic stimulus package to lessen the burden of individuals and businesses due to the Covid-19 pandemic impact, as well as the US-China trade war which indirectly opened up business opportunities for ASEAN countries including Malaysia,' he said.</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_96><loc_453><loc_117>Exports to the Oceania market, which includes Australia and New Zealand, also improved, recording an increase of 19% to RM297.7 million.</text>
<text><loc_46><loc_129><loc_449><loc_163>However, Muhtar said exports to both the African and Asian markets shrank. Exports to Africa fell by 5.1% to RM91.8 million, while those to Asia dropped by 11% to RM2.66 billion.</text>

What is the primary focus of the first section?

The primary focus of the first section is to introduce the first ever Evoking Art Experience, an event to showcase, collaborate, engage and connect with the broader creative culture that exists in the Wilderness area.
When and where will the Evoking Art Experience take place?
The Evoking Art Experience will take place on Saturday, 24 April, from 2-11pm at the author's studio and Timberlake Organic Village.
What types of talents will be showcased at the Evoking Art Experience?
The event will showcase diverse artistic talents in Wilderness and the surrounding areas, including painters, mural artists, musicians, and poets.
What additional activities can attendees expect at the Evoking Art Experience?
Attendees can expect art auctions, poetry recitals, a drum performance, live music, and more at the event.
Is there an entrance fee for the Evoking Art Experience?
No, the Evoking Art Experience is free of charge. However, there are limited VIP tickets available for R500 each.
What special benefits do VIP ticket holders receive at the Evoking Art Experience?
VIP ticket holders receive a limited edition "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" print by Ingrid Nuss, R200 bid credit for the auction, a seat at a VIP table, and complimentary canapes and wine.
What is the "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" print inspired by?
The "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" print is inspired by star trails, visual patterns of audio frequencies, organic patterns, and images of paradise.
How many large, signed, limited edition prints of "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" are available?
There are 10 large, signed, limited edition prints of "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" available.
Can attendees view the original painting of "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" at the event?
Yes, attendees can view the original painting of "Conducting Day-To-Day Life" at the Evoking Art Experience.
Aside from the Evoking Art Experience, what other limited edition print offer is available?
There is a limited offer to purchase the author's Jungle Series (set of 3 prints) for R525, valid for the next two weeks.

<doctag><section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_96><loc_190><loc_102>Subject: Can I count you in?</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_117><loc_161><loc_124>Hey there {first name},</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_59><loc_137><loc_432><loc_154>Shoo, what a month. I've been super busy cooking up some magic for you to look forward to. Let's dive right in.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_167><loc_410><loc_184>TL;DR: The first ever Evoking Art Experience is happening on 24 April from 2-11pm. Get your tickets here. You don't want to miss this one.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_196><loc_423><loc_223>There is so much artistic talent in Wilderness and the surrounding areas. I'm talking painters, mural artists, musicians, and poets. It's about time there was an event that brought this emerging talent together.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_236><loc_432><loc_263>So I teamed up with a bunch of local artists, across multiple disciplines, to bring a first-of-its-kind event to the Garden Route. And not just anywhere on the Garden Route, but right here in my lovely little studio.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_276><loc_440><loc_302>The Evoking Art Experience will take place on Saturday, 24 April from 2-11pm. A platform to showcase, collaborate, engage and connect with the broader creative culture that exists in the Wilderness area.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_315><loc_143><loc_322>Evoking flyer here</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_59><loc_335><loc_412><loc_352>Now, my studio is waaaaay too small to host all this awesomeness by itself. So Timberlake Organic Village jumped onboard to help host the event.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_365><loc_434><loc_382>You can expect a lively outdoor environment where creatives and collectors get to connect and enjoy the creative spirit together.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_395><loc_423><loc_411>There'll be art auctions, poetry recitals, a drum performance, live music, and so much more.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_424><loc_291><loc_431>Sounds amazing right? But get this: it's totally free.</text>
<page_footer><loc_59><loc_471><loc_228><loc_476>Ingrid Nuss April Newsletter © Quiller Copy 2021</page_footer>
<picture><loc_232><loc_24><loc_269><loc_63></picture>
<page_break>
<picture><loc_231><loc_25><loc_269><loc_63></picture>
<text><loc_59><loc_87><loc_433><loc_113>That's right. For the same price as a Vic Bay peeler, you'll be entertained, inspired, and get to meet the happy faces creating amazing art in this beautiful part of the world.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_126><loc_423><loc_153>And I'll be honest, it's shaping up to be a bit of a party too. Local favourites will warm things up on the mainstage before our visitors from Cape Town keep you entertained aer sunset.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_166><loc_115><loc_173>Lineup here</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_59><loc_186><loc_169><loc_193>Space is limited though.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_206><loc_427><loc_222>So if you haven't already, go to the Evoking website now to register for your free ticket so you don't miss out. Easy peasy.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_235><loc_426><loc_252>If you want more of a tailored experience, I have something for you. There are a small number of VIP tickets available at R500 a pop. VIP's get:</text>
<unordered_list><list_item><loc_74><loc_255><loc_421><loc_272>● Limited edition 'Conducting Day-To-Day Life' print by Ingrid Nuss (A3. Only 50 available)</list_item>
<list_item><loc_74><loc_275><loc_231><loc_282>● R200 bid credit for the auction</list_item>
<list_item><loc_74><loc_285><loc_170><loc_292>● Seat at a VIP table</list_item>
<list_item><loc_74><loc_295><loc_245><loc_302>● Complimentary canapes and wine</list_item>
</unordered_list>
<text><loc_59><loc_315><loc_436><loc_331>I'm pretty sure all this comes to a value of more than R500. So you better jump on this quick before everyone else catches on. Go here for the VIP treatment.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_356><loc_211><loc_366>Limited edition prints</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_59><loc_374><loc_434><loc_391>I've had a few other things in the works as well. First up, you have the opportunity to collect 1 of 10 large, signed, limited edition prints of an original painting.</text>

<text><loc_59><loc_87><loc_441><loc_102>This painting speaks volumes about how I feel about how you live your life. Especially where there is a choice involved around taking control of your actions.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_114><loc_438><loc_137>Despite the difficulties (or opportunities for growth) we have a strong capability to steer our lives. Every action has a ripple effect and an energy flow, and we have the power to choose to see the positive.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_150><loc_222><loc_156>Claim your print. Only 10 available.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_169><loc_423><loc_186>Come and view the original painting at the Evoking Art Experience (that you've already got your ticket for, right?).</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_199><loc_441><loc_226>Because you're on my list, you're the first to hear about these limited edition prints. In a week or two, I'm going to let the masses on social media know about them. So if you have a wall that needs some sprucing up, don't delay.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_239><loc_368><loc_246>Phew, that's a lot for one month. But I have one more thing for you.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_261><loc_274><loc_271>Thrice as nice for half the price</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_59><loc_278><loc_403><loc_295>For the next two weeks, you can grab my Jungle Series (set of 3 prints) for a whopping 50% off. Yup, that's 3 prints for the pocket friendly price of R525.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_59><loc_308><loc_137><loc_315>Photo of set here</section_header_level_1>

<text><loc_59><loc_348><loc_438><loc_364>This offer only applies for the next 2 weeks. So, you guessed it, don't wait around if you've had your eye on these (are you starting to notice a theme here?).</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_377><loc_429><loc_394>OK. That's it for now. I'll be back in your inbox next month with some more cool stuff for you.</text>
<text><loc_59><loc_407><loc_239><loc_414>If you spot me at Evoking, come say hi!</text>

What is the purpose of the document?
The primary focus of the document is to invite interested, eligible, and competent contractors to bid for the Provision of OMARH Consolidation Services.
What are the eligibility requirements for the contractors?

The significant details mentioned in the eligibility requirements include the submission of certificates such as the Certificate of Incorporation with the Corporate Affairs Commission, certified true copy of Memorandum and Articles of Association, evidence of registration with Abia state Works Registration Unit, company audited accounts for the last one year, tax clearance for the last three years, evidence of financial capability and banking support, a company average annual turnover of not less than Five Million Naira, evidence of a similar project executed at least three times in the last five years, verifiable evidence of company profile and technical qualification of key personnel, VAT registration and evidence of past remittance, and that the company has fulfilled all obligations to pay taxes, pensions, and social security contributions.
How should the tender documents be submitted?

The technical and financial bids should be submitted in two different sealed envelopes labeled “Technical” and “Financial Bid” respectively. Both envelopes should be sealed in to one envelope also sealed and marked with the project name at the top right-hand corner and addressed to The Permanent Secretary, Abia State Ministry of Health, Government House Complex, Umuahia, Abia State.
What happens if the bids are submitted late or through email or fax?
Late submissions will be rejected, and submission of tender through email or fax will not be accepted.
How will the bids be opened and considered?

Technical and financial bids received should be opened immediately after the deadline for submission by 1:00pm at the Okpara conference Hall, Government House, Umuahia, Abia State. Only the bids that meet the pre-qualification requirements shall be considered.
What is the validity period for the bids?
The bid validity period should be 90 days from the deadline of the bid submission date.

What is the summary of the letter?

The letter is a notification that franchise owners of Cell Phone Repair have decided to form an independent owner's association, called CPRIOA, to focus on advocacy with the franchisor, education and best practice sharing amongst franchisees, and providing value-added benefits for its members.
What is the purpose of forming the CPRIOA?
The purpose of forming the CPRIOA is to serve the franchisee community by focusing on mutually beneficial solutions to protect and enhance the Cell Phone Repair brand now and into the future.
What will be the primary focus of the CPRIOA?

The primary focus of the CPRIOA will be advocacy with the franchisor, facilitating education and best practice sharing amongst the franchisee community, and providing value-added benefits for its members.
Who will run the CPRIOA?
The CPRIOA will be run by a volunteer board of directors consisting of seven franchisees in good standing.
Who will manage the day-to-day administrative activities of the CPRIOA?
The day-to-day administrative activities of the CPRIOA will be managed by Elevanta, an established association management company.
When is the formation process of the CPRIOA expected to be completed?
The formation process of the CPRIOA is expected to be completed by Dec. 31, 2019.
What is the full name of the independent owner's association being formed?
The full name of the independent owner's association being formed is Cell Phone Repair Independent Owners Association (CPRIOA).
What is CPRIOA and what is its proposed function?

CPRIOA stands for Cell Phone Repair Independent Owners Association, and its proposed function is to serve the franchisee community by focusing on advocacy with the franchisor, facilitating education and best practice sharing amongst the franchisee community, and providing value-added benefits for its members.
How many franchisees will be on the CPRIOA volunteer board of directors, and what will be their status?
The volunteer board of directors for CPRIOA will consist of seven franchisees in good standing.
Which company will manage the day-to-day administrative activities of CPRIOA?
Elevanta, an established association management company, will manage the day-to-day administrative activities of CPRIOA.
When does CPRIOA expect the formation process to be completed?
CPRIOA expects the formation process to be completed by December 31, 2019.
What is the primary motivation behind the formation of CPRIOA?

The primary motivation behind the formation of CPRIOA is to serve the franchisee community by focusing on mutually beneficial solutions to protect and enhance the Cell Phone Repair brand now and into the future.
To whom was the letter of intent regarding the formation of CPRIOA addressed?
The letter of intent regarding the formation of CPRIOA was addressed to Mr. Manny Becerra, President of Connected Living, Assurant, Inc.
What will be the name of the independent owner's association formed by the franchise owners of Cell Phone Repair?
The independent owner's association formed by the franchise owners of Cell Phone Repair will be known as Cell Phone Repair Independent Owners Association (CPRIOA).

What is the main focus of the PEARL TF-PV project?
The PEARL TF-PV project focuses on improving the reliability, yield, and prediction of overall plant lifetime for thin-film photovoltaics (PV) power plants using electroluminescence imaging methods.
Why is module reliability crucial for the economic success of PV plants?
Module reliability is crucial for the economic success of PV plants because unexpected yield reduction or increase in maintenance expenses can seriously threaten the plant's economic viability.
What challenge does the PEARL TF-PV project address in the thin-film PV industry?

The PEARL TF-PV project addresses the challenge of interpreting test results for thin-film technologies, reducing uncertainty in investment models and maintenance reserve estimates, which ultimately reduces the bankability of thin-film PV projects.
How does the PEARL TF-PV project contribute to the photovoltaic community and the energy industry?

The PEARL TF-PV project contributes to the photovoltaic community and the energy industry by establishing a database of defects in industrial and minimodules, bringing state-of-the-art image analysis methods into the community, and improving power rating standardization techniques.
Who are the partners involved in the PEARL TF-PV project?
The partners involved in the PEARL TF-PV project include organizations from Germany, The Netherlands, and Austria, with Forschungszentrum Jülich acting as the coordinator.
What is the total public funding received by the PEARL TF-PV project?
The total public funding received by the PEARL TF-PV project is 2,253,946 EUR.
When did the PEARL TF-PV project start and end?
The PEARL TF-PV project started on July 1, 2017, and ended on January 31, 2021.
What type of photovoltaics are the focus of the PEARL TF-PV project?
The PEARL TF-PV project focuses on thin-film photovoltaics.
Why is pre-installation testing and field inspection important for PV plants?
Pre-installation testing and field inspection are important for PV plants because they can reduce investment risks and increase plant yield.
What is the significance of electroluminescence imaging methods in the PEARL TF-PV project?

Electroluminescence imaging methods are significant in the PEARL TF-PV project because they are used to improve plant reliability, yield, and prediction of overall plant lifetime, while also contributing to a better understanding of defects and failure mechanisms in thin-film modules.

<doctag><picture><loc_47><loc_21><loc_170><loc_40></picture>
<page_header><loc_239><loc_25><loc_451><loc_38>Report on Projects Funded and Initiated through Transnational SOLAR-ERA.NET Joint Calls   -  Public Summaries</page_header>
<section_header_level_1><loc_198><loc_63><loc_302><loc_72>450 PEARL TF-PV:</section_header_level_1>
<section_header_level_1><loc_65><loc_73><loc_438><loc_91>Performance and Electroluminescence Analysis on Reliability and Lifetime of Thin-Film Photovoltaics</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_175><loc_101><loc_328><loc_117>Project Duration: 07.2017 to 01.2021 Report submitted: 09.2020</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_48><loc_137><loc_96><loc_145>Summary</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_48><loc_150><loc_455><loc_194>Renewable energy assets are characterised by a high initial investment, long payback times and low operational costs. This is especially true for PV plants. PV modules represent up to 50% of the investment,  and  module  reliability  is  crucial  for  the  economic  success  of  the  plant.  Each unexpected  yield  reduction  or  increase  in  maintenance  expenses  will  seriously  threaten  the economic viability of the plant.</text>
<text><loc_48><loc_199><loc_455><loc_242>Pre-installation testing and field inspection can reduce investment risks and increase plant yield. For  silicon  wafer  technologies,  there  exists  a  generally  accepted  set  of  standards  for  rejecting modules  that  are  unlikely  to  perform  to  specification.  However  for  thin  film,  it  is  not  yet  fully understood how to interpret  the  test  results.  This  introduces  uncertainty  into  investment  models and maintenance reserve estimates, in turn reducing bankability of thin film PV projects.</text>
<text><loc_48><loc_248><loc_455><loc_273>The  project  aims  to  reduce  the  cost  of  electricity  produced  by  thin-film  PV  power  plants,  by improving plant reliability, yield, and prediction of overall plant lifetime using electroluminescence imaging methods.</text>
<text><loc_48><loc_278><loc_455><loc_313>The  knowledge  gain  on  the  appearance,  behaviour  and  progression  of  failure  mechanisms acquired during this project is implemented to strengthen the productivity and competitiveness of European industry within the O&M and quality assurance industry, as well as within the thin film research and manufacturing sector.</text>
<text><loc_48><loc_318><loc_455><loc_388>In  particular,  the  PEARL  TF-PV  project  contributes  to  the  photovoltaic  community  and  to  the energy  industry  as  a  whole  in  the  following  ways.  Firstly,  the  extensive  database  of  defects  in industrial and minimodules established during the project provides a better understanding on the origin and evolution of defects and failure-mechanisms in thin-film modules. Secondly, the project brought the state-of-the-art image analysis methods into the photovoltaics community allowing fast processing of large quantities of image data, hence indirectly decreasing O&M costs. Lastly, the power rating standardisation techniques are now better understood, allowing more precise module characterisation.</text>
<text><loc_48><loc_393><loc_455><loc_410>The  project  brought  together  partners  from  research  and  industry,  gathered  knowledge  from different fields and opened new possibilities for future collaborations.</text>

What are the main challenges that people face in their lives according to the text?
The main challenges that people face are our lack of control and power, life's cares and difficulties, and difficulties in trusting Jesus and others in the midst of these challenges.
How does the text depict Jesus' role in leading and guiding his followers?

The text depicts Jesus as the shepherd of the sheep, who does what is impossible in his own time and manner. Jesus calls his own sheep by name, leads them out of the metaphorical sheepfold, and openly invites them to follow him. His followers recognize his voice and are comforted by his presence.
What is the purpose of the "Life on Purpose" series mentioned in the text?

The purpose of the "Life on Purpose" series is to encourage people to invite their neighbors to discover, enjoy, and share the life that Jesus offers, by creating an invitational culture where people can experience true life together. This is achieved through the community's mission to share the invitation to Jesus with others in their neighborhoods.
According to the text, how can Jesus' followers reach out to their neighbors and invite them to experience the life Jesus offers?

Jesus' followers can reach out to their neighbors by living out the life that Jesus offers, sharing their personal experiences of discovering, enjoying, and sharing this life with others, and inviting their neighbors to join them for various community events and activities.
What is the difference between a "life thief" and a "good shepherd" according to the text?

The difference between a "life thief" and a "good shepherd" is their respective purposes. The life thief, referred to as Jesus' predecessors, aims to steal and kill, while the good shepherd, Jesus himself, seeks to give his sheep a rich and satisfying life and sacrifices his own life for their well-being.
What is the significance of the phrase "Life's cares and difficulties make it difficult to believe God cares" in the text?

The significance of this phrase is to highlight the various challenges people face in their lives, which can make it difficult for them to trust that God truly cares for them. This theme is addressed in the text by presenting Jesus' actions as evidence that God does care for his followers, even in the midst of their struggles and difficulties.

What is the purpose of Smartcare™ childcare management system implemented by Early Learning Academies?

The purpose of Smartcare™ childcare management system implemented by Early Learning Academies is to provide a cohesive platform for real-time communication that enables the center, teachers, and parents to be connected through mobile devices and the web throughout the day.
What steps are involved in setting up a Smartcare app account?

The steps involved in setting up a Smartcare app account include downloading the application, opening it, entering your email and password provided by the center at the time of enrollment, and tapping login.
How can parents change their Smartcare app password?

Parents can change their Smartcare app password by tapping Settings at the bottom of the screen, selecting Change Password, entering their current password, entering their new password twice to confirm, and then tapping Change Password.
What is the procedure for checking in and out children using the Smartcare app?

To check in and out children using the Smartcare app, parents need to sign in to the app, tap Sign-in/Out at the bottom menu, scan the QR code on the kiosk or enter the PIN, select the child they are signing in or out of, and then tap Login.
How do teachers use Smartcare™ to communicate with families about daily activities?

Teachers use Smartcare™ to update families on a child's daily activities through the Timeline feature, which provides updates throughout the day with photos, meal notes, nap times, milestones, videos, and more.
How can parents reply to a timeline entry made by their child's teacher?

Parents can reply to a timeline entry made by their child's teacher by tapping on the entry to open it, tapping Add a comment at the bottom, entering their message, and then tapping the arrow on the right when finished.
How do parents receive notifications regarding timeline entries made by their child's school?

Parents receive notifications regarding timeline entries made by their child's school through the Redicon icon located above the Bell in the upper right corner of the Smartcare app. Notifications can be accessed from any Smartcare page.
How are tuition payments processed using Smartcare™?

Tuition payments are processed through Smartcare™ using credit cards. Upon enrolling their child(ren), parents choose their payment frequency (weekly or monthly) and the staff applies the appropriate tuition plan. Weekly payments are processed every Monday, and monthly payments are processed on the first working day of every month. Additional charges like late fees and field trip fees are also applied and processed according to the tuition plan.
How can parents review their billing statement on Smartcare™?

Parents can review their billing statement on Smartcare™ by tapping Billing at the bottom menu, navigating to the Billing screen, scrolling through the account summary and list of statements, and tapping on a specific statement date to view details.
What is the process for setting up a payment method for billing on Smartcare™?

The process for setting up a payment method for billing on Smartcare™ involves tapping Billing at the bottom menu, tapping Settings, choosing to either Add a Credit Card or Add a Bank Account, entering the required information, and then saving the payment method. To mark a payment method as the default, parents need to go back to the Billing screen, tap Settings again, and then tap the circle next to the desired payment method.

What is the file number and title of the document?
The file number is DMA2/767/2020-DMD-Part(4) and the title is "Disaster Management Department - Restrictions imposed in the State as a part of COVID-19 containment activities from 22nd July 2021".
What is the main objective of the orders issued by the Kerala government?
The main objective of the orders issued by the Kerala government is to impose restrictions as part of COVID-19 containment activities.
Which department issued the orders and on what date was the latest order issued?
The Disaster Management (A) Department issued the orders, and the latest order was issued on 20th July 2021.
According to the Supreme Court's order, what constitutional articles should the State give heed to during the pandemic?
According to the Supreme Court's order, the State should give heed to Article 21 read with Article 144 of the Constitution of India.
As per the interim order, when should the enforcement authorities strictly implement the additional guidelines?
The enforcement authorities should strictly implement the additional guidelines starting from 00:00 Hrs of 22nd July 2021.
Will there be any additional relaxations granted in any area under any circumstances?
No, there will be no additional relaxations granted anywhere under any circumstances.
On which dates will there be a complete lockdown, and what previous event do these dates coincide with?
There will be a complete lockdown on 24th and 25th July 2021, which coincide with Saturday and Sunday, respectively. These dates are similar to the lockdown imposed on 12th and 13th June 2021.
What is the target number of tests to be conducted during the mass testing campaign in Kerala?
The target number of tests to be conducted during the mass testing campaign in Kerala is 3 lakh tests.
On which day is the mass testing campaign scheduled to take place?
The mass testing campaign is scheduled to take place on Friday, 23rd July 2021.
Which department is directed to conduct the mass testing campaign and monitor the number of daily tests?
The Health and Family Welfare Department is directed to conduct the mass testing campaign and monitor the number of daily tests.

<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_54><loc_374><loc_62>New Interest Rates under the Civil and Commercial Code</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_73><loc_467><loc_120>In response to the impact of the Covid-19 on the economy, the Government of Thailand has issued and implement dozens of financial, monetary, and medical and public health measures in the past 18 months. One of them is the Emergency Decree on the Amendment to the Civil and Commercial Code (' CCC ') B.E. 2564, which was published in the Government Gazette on 10 th  April 2021 and came into force on 11 th  April 2021.  The Amendment governs the interest rates charged by and payable to non-financial institution lenders/creditors starting from 11 th  April 2021.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_130><loc_178><loc_136>Interest Rate under Section 7</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_145><loc_467><loc_179>Interest on debts or obligations are payable at the rate of 3% per annum (reduced from 7.5% p.a.) unless expressly agreed otherwise in an agreement or specified otherwise in other laws.  The 3% interest rate can be changed to a lower or higher rate by a Royal Decree, which may be issued from time to time, in response to the prevailing economic conditions.  Generally, the Ministry of Finance shall review the interest rate every period of 3 years taking into account the interest rates of deposits and loans of commercial banks.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_188><loc_337><loc_194>Default Interest Rate and No Compound Interest under Section 224</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_202><loc_467><loc_222>The new default interest rate is the interest rate under Section 7 plus 2% per annum.  However, the creditor can charge a higher default interest rate if there is a legitimate ground for such a higher rate.  No compound interest is allowed.</text>
<section_header_level_1><loc_53><loc_231><loc_386><loc_237>Default Interest Only on Specific Default Principal Amount under Section 224/1</section_header_level_1>
<text><loc_53><loc_245><loc_467><loc_265>If a debtor fails to pay the installment payment of any installment amount, the creditor can demand a default interest on that default principal amount only.  Any provision in an agreement contrary to Section 224/1 is void.</text>
<picture><loc_53><loc_284><loc_96><loc_319></picture>
